Don't know if been mentioned here yet, but I found this to be hilarious.
 
 www.venganza.org
 
 Here's an exert from Wiki:
 
 Many of the "beliefs" proposed by Henderson were intentionally chosen to parody arguments commonly set forth by proponents of Intelligent Design:
 
 * An invisible and undetectable Flying Spaghetti Monster created the universe, starting with a mountain, trees and a "midgit". All evidence pointing towards evolution was intentionally planted by this being.
 
 * Global warming, earthquakes, hurricanes, and other natural disasters are a direct consequence of the decline in numbers of pirates since the 1800s. A graph showing the inverse correlation between the pirates and global temperatures was also provided. This component of the theory highlights the logical fallacy of correlation implying causation.
 
 * The monster continues to guide human affairs with his "noodly appendage".
 
 * Prayers to "Him" are typically ended by "Ramen", instead of "Amen".
 
 * Heaven has a stripper factory and a beer volcano.
 
 * Bobby Henderson is the "prophet" of this religion.
 
 * Every Friday is a religious holiday.

* Every Friday is a religious holiday.

 Also people write parodies on the Bible. 
 But for some reason, I have never heard about parodies on Koran or other sacred books. But it doesn't matter.
 I think the Fake street is populated by fake people.

Yes, well, it's hard to write a parody on a book you've never read, and the people who are more likely to write parodies in english that you and I would have access too are much more likely to have read more of the Bible than the Qur'an.
 
 And even then, I think up Qur'an parodies some of the time, but generally I don't write them down.
 
 And yes, the Church of the Flying Spaghetti Monster is already well known here on the 4Forums, along with a curious selection of other Edible Foodstuffs Dieties, such as the Great Languini in the Sky. (Was it you that told me that one, C14?)
